Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Piercing Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Necrotic Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Radiant Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Round Buckler
entries: This small metal shield is held by a simple handle for ease of maneuvering. It increases your Armor Class by 1 (replacing the shield's normal bonus to AC) and you are proficient in its use if you are proficient with light armor. It also weighs half as much as a regular shield and can be donned or doffed without using an action.

item.name: Dwarven Eagle Axe
entries: This mighty silver and gem-bladed weapon deals {@dice 1d10} slashing damage when wielded one handed and {@dice 1d12} slashing damage when wielded with two hands.
this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.

Eagle Cleave: When you take the Attack action while wielding a Dwarven Eagle Axe, you may make one additional attack as a bonus action, using the “opposite” head of the axe. You do not add your Strength modifier to the damage of this attack unless you have the Two-Weapon Fighting fighting style.

item.name: Dwarven Titan Hammer
entries: This power hammer shaped like a might titan deals {@dice 1d12} damage when wielded.
This weapon inflicts one stack of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

item.name: Dwarven Thorned Spear
entries: This jagged heavy spear deals {@dice 1d6} damage
this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.
When you successfuly damage a living creature with this weapon on your turn, if they attempt to move away from your threatened range on their turn they take 1d6 piercing damage

item.name: Dwarven Sharp Throwing Hammer
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.
This heavy small hammer, while commonly used for construction, makes for a great improvised throwing weapon. This weapon deals {@dice 1d6} slashing damage.

item.name: Katana
entries: This gently curved sword allows a properly trained wielder to make blindingly quick strikes.This weapon has the finesse property and deals {@dice 1d8} damage while wielded one handed and {@dice 1d10} while weilded in two hands.
blade master: At the start of combat, you gain advantage on your first attack with this weapon.

item.name: Ritual Scythe
entries: This common farming tool is a common weapon used by cultists and those who worship death. The Ritual Scythe deals {@dice 1d8} damage
Drained Blade: Every time you kill a creature with the ritual scythe, your next successful attack deals an additional 1d8 necrotic damage.

item.name: Gith Mind Blade
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by Gith or those with training in Korasiam weaponry.
This verstatile blade actually uses mental energy to create a sharp plasma based blade. THe Gith Mind blade deals {@dice 1d4} damage one handed and {@dice 1d6} two handed
This weapon can be used as an arcane focus for the purposes of casting spells.
Spells dealing psychic damage deal an additional damage die.

item.name: Gith Mind Whip
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by Gith or those with training in Korasiam weaponry.
This peculiar verstatile whip uses mental energy to create a sharp plasma based blade. THe Gith Mind Whip deals {@dice 1d4} damage one handed and {@dice 1d6} two handed
This weapon can be used as an arcane focus for the purposes of casting spells.
Spells dealing psychic damage deal an additional damage die.

item.name: Gith Astral 900 Pistol
entries: Reload: 10
this weapon may only be wielded by Gith or those with training in Korasiam weaponry.

This strange block pistol has a 12 inch elongated barrell with purple crystaline streaks on each side, rectangular magazine, and pristine exact machining that makes it hard to differentiate between an artistic metal figure and a firearm with a break. This weapon deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and {@dice 1d4} Psychic damage.
Quick Load: It is a Bonus action to reload this weapon with a premade Astral 900 Magazine.

item.name: Tower Shield
entries: This thick, unwieldy shield is large enough to cover you from ankle to shoulder. It increases your armor class by 3 (this replaces the shield's normal bonus to AC.) While this shield is equipped, you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and if your Strength score is lower than 15, your speed is reduced by 10 feet as if you were wearing heavy armor. It weighs twice as much as a regular shield.
Shield Wall: As a action you may angle your shield become a haven against arrows. Your speed is reduced to zero and you gain +10 to your ac against ranged melee attacks.

item.name: Dwarven Tower Shield
entries: This inhuman stone slab is enchanted with countless runes and is ordained with jewels and precious metals. It increases your armor class by 3 (this replaces the shield's normal bonus to AC.) While this shield is equipped, you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and if your Strength score is lower than 15, your speed is reduced by 10 feet as if you were wearing heavy armor.

Mountain Wall: As an action you may slam your shield into the ground and 'lock down'. While in this stance the shield acts as a 5 ft. full cover wall (200 HP. 22 AC) and is resistant to all damage types. It takes an action to lift your shield out of the ground.

item.name: Firearm Ammunition
entries: These rounds are simplistic in nature and are invidiual pieces used for firearms.

item.name: Empty Magazine
entries: An empty magazine needing to be filled.

item.name: Firearm Shell
entries: These rounds are a more advanced types of ammunition. Bearings, slugs, or other projectiles loaded into shells with an ignition cap allow the projectiles to explode foreward.

item.name: Harmonica Clip
entries: Specialty clip used for a harmonica rifle. This device holds 6 rounds

item.name: Astral 900 Magazine
entries: Specialty magazine used for a Astral. This device holds 10 rounds

item.name: Fuel Tank
entries: Specialty Tank used for the flame thrower. Holds 5 units of fuel.
Fuel tanks can be reloaded with 10 units of alchemical fire over a five minute time period to be reloaded.

item.name: Alchemical Fire
entries: A key component in explosives and ignition. ALchemical fire can come in many form such as powder, liquid, and gelatinous states.

item.name: Cog Revolver
entries: Reload: 4
The most common and yet most deadly firearm, cog revolvers are staples of most modern armies.Cog revolvers use cartridge ammunition and do {@dice 1d8} piercing damage.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Highnoon: As an action you may speed fire all the ammunition in the revolver. You may make separate attacks at creatures within range at disadvantage for every round fired. It takes half the rounds fired (rounded down) for the gun to cool down so it may be reloaded.

item.name: Boomstick
entries: Reload: 2

The short range but powerful boomstick is a common weapon of riflemen as it is able to unleash close range destruction. The boomstick does {@dice 4d4} piercing damage and consume two ammunition per shot.
breakaction: As a bonus acction you may reload all ammunition in this weapon.

item.name: Steam Rifle
entries: Reload: 1

A powerful long range weapon able to send destruction down range, steam rifles are common place amongst scouts. Steam rifles deal {@dice 3d6} piercing damage and use cartridge ammunition. It takes an action to reload the steam rifle

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Steady Shot: As an action you may crouch to steady your aim. Your movement speed is reduced to zero and you are treated as prone.  While in this state you gain an additonal +5 to all attack rolls made with the steam rifle. It is an action to stand up.
Reload: 6
This peculiar weapon uses a harmonica like magazine to pass bullets into into the chamber.
Quick Load: It is a Bonus action to reload this weapon with a premade harmonica clip.

item.name: Pepperbox
entries: Reload: 3
This strange four barreled box loads four shells at a time to be used. Inaccurate but wildly effective against multiple targets clumped together.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

item.name: Arquebus
entries: Reload: 1

Bulky: Firearms and ranged weapons with the bulky property have to be made stable in order to be fired effectively due to their weight and the damage they can put out with a single shot. You cannot attack more than once during your turn while wielding a bulky firearm.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Firing Platform: as a bonus action you may stand the base of the arquebus into the ground. Your movement speed becomes zero and any attacks with the arquebus have advantage. It is a free action to abandon the arqebus and a full round action to restock the stand.

item.name: Dragoon Revolver
entries: Reload: 6

A tried and true firearm from the United Empires to the West, the Dragoon is a testament to engineering as it is capable of being used in any weather or battle condition. The dragoon deals {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Scatter: Firearms with the scatter property have two types of damage, a regular damage roll and a scatter damage roll. When you make an attack roll with one of these guns against a creature, compare your attack roll to the AC of all creatures within 5 feet of the target. If your attack would hit them, deal the firearm's scatter damage roll to the creatures. You do not add your ability score modifier to the damage of this attack, unless that modifier is negative.

item.name: Flame Thrower
entries: Reload: 5

Bulky: Firearms and ranged weapons with the bulky property have to be made stable in order to be fired effectively due to their weight and the damage they can put out with a single shot. You cannot attack more than once during your turn while wielding a bulky firearm.

Firestarter: You can make a normal single-target attack with a flamethrower using 1 unit of ammunition, or you can spray everything in a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot long line by dispensing 10 units of Ammunition. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 15) or take the flamethrower's normal damage. The flames of the flamethrower linger for six rounds and any creature who enters,starts, or ends the space of the flame takes the full damage of the flame thrower.
This item requires a special backpack item called a 'Fuel Tank' to be used. It is a full round action to attach a fuel tank to the flamethrower. Fuel Tanks carry 5 units of ammunition.

item.name: Burst Rifle
entries: Reload: 6
Magazine Load: It is an action to reload this weapon with a premade Rifle clip.

Burst Fire: Burst fire firearms are able to make a special attack that releases a stream of multiple bullets. As an action, you can force up to 3 creatures of your choice in a 15-foot square centered on a point within your gun's maximum range to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 13), taking your gun's burst fire damage on a failed save, and half that damage on a success. This action subtracts rounds from your gun equal to the number of creatures affected, to a maximum of 3.
Additionally, guns with the burst fire property always expend 3 rounds per attack.
Burst Fire Save DC (Not Proficienct) = 12
Burst Fire Save DC (Proficient) = 8 + Dexterity + Profiicency Bonus

item.name: Crow Quill
entries: This strange combination of chained throwing knives and rope daggers seems to be obtuse to use but in the hands of a deadly kenku can have serious side effects for ones health.
this weapon may only be wielded by Kenku or those with training in Goldwing Rookery weaponry.
This weapon inflicts two stacks of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

item.name: Talon Hook
entries: This strange club contains a hollowed interior able to produce astonisingly powerful wind gusts. Those hit by it have their skin rended open.
this weapon may only be wielded by Kenku or those with training in Goldwing Rookery weaponry.
This weapon inflicts two stacks of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

item.name: Stone Armor
entries: This finely crafted dwarven masterpiece is the peak of protection. If an attack were to be a critical hit against you, you take non-critical damage. This effect can only happens once per round of combat.

item.name: Hunter's Armor
entries: Designed for Huntsmen going into combat, Hunter's Armor is able to absorb blows better than any other material. Once per day you can choose to negate all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage taken during a turn. This ability must be used before a damage roll is calculated.

item.name: Void Armor
entries: This terrifying armor made of pure void stone is nigh impervious to most standard atacks.

item.name: Reinforced Plate Armor
entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
This armor or shield has been reinforced at the joints and other weak points. While wearing it, critical damage you take from nonmagical attacks is reduced by 3.

item.name: Absorbant Breastplate
entries: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.
The armor is padded with thick batting made from special absorbent fibers. This tends to wipe clean any sharp objects that penetrate it.
The wearer of this armor has resistance to poison damage from poison-coated weapons, but not from the fangs of creatures that inject their venom as they bite.

item.name: Half Plate Armor
entries: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

item.name: Breathable Leather Armor
entries: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.
While wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws you make against exhaustion effects due to extreme heat, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

item.name: Chain Mail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: Chain Shirt
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

item.name: Piercing Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all piercing damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Acidic Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all acid damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Soft Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all bludgeoning damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Quilted Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all slashing damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Heated Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all cold damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Iced Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all fire damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Rubber Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all lighting damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Sound Absorbant Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all thunder damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Lead Lined Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all radiant damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Poppy Milk Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.
While wearing this armor, all necrotic damage is reduced by 3.

item.name: Camouflaged Scale Mail
entries: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

You can take 1 hour to aquire natural foliage and materials to create a thin layering on this armor. If you do, you gain advantage on stealth rolls while in this specific type of terrain. If takes 1 hour to remove the thin camouflage layering.

item.name: Spiked Armor
entries: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
When you use the attack action to grapple a creature, the target takes {@dice 1d3} piercing damage if your grapple check succeeds.

item.name: Club
entries: blackjack: Make a single attack roll with your club against a humanoid target. If the attack hits, it does no damage, but the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 12) or be stunned until the beginning of its next turn.

item.name: Dagger
entries: Concealed Blade: Instead of making a Dexterity (Stealth) check to hide yourself, you may make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check—contested by an active or passive Wisdom (Perception) check—to conceal your dagger. As an action, you may make a weapon attack with a concealed dagger against a creature that has not yet acted in combat. This attack has advantage.

item.name: Flail
entries: Shield Snare: As an action while wielding a flail, you may make a single attack roll against a target carrying a shield or a similar defensive tool. This attack ignores any bonus to AC granted by the shield and deals normal weapon damage. If the attack hits, the target must also make a Strength saving throw (DC 12). On a failure, its shield is pulled from its grip and lands at its feet.

item.name: Glaive
entries: Glaive: As an attack while you are wielding a glaive, you may sweep your opponent’s legs in an attempt to trip them. Make an attack roll against a Large or smaller creature. If the attack hits, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 12) or fall prone.

item.name: Greataxe
entries: Sundering Blow: As part of the attack action, make a single attack roll with your greataxe against a creature wielding a weapon, including natural weapons at disadvantage. If the attack hits, the weapon is damaged, and all attacks made with this weapon have disadvantage. Another sundering strike destroys the weapon. This attack has no effect on magical weapons, unless your nordmansch is also magical.

item.name: Greatclub
entries: SKull Basher: Make a single attack roll with your greatclub against a humanoid target. This attack does normal weapon damage and the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 12). On a failure, it is stunned until the beginning of its next turn. If the damage you dealt was greater than the creature’s maximum hit dice, it is stunned until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Greatsword
entries: Arching Slice: When you attack with a greatsword, you may choose to target two creatures within your reach with a single attack. This attack uses the same attack roll for both targets and deals slashing damage equal to 1d6 plus your Strength modifier to each target.

item.name: Halberd
entries: Rubuff: As an attack while you are wielding a halberd, you may use the haft of your weapon to rebuff up to two adjacent creatures. Make a single attack roll against one or two adjacent creatures within 5 feet of you. If the attack hits a target, you push it up to 10 feet away from you.

item.name: Handaxe
entries: Pinning Edge: When you make a melee or ranged weapon attack with a hand axe, you may attempt to pin a Large or smaller creature to a wall or surface by catching their clothing with the axe’s edge. This maneuver can be used against creatures without clothing at the GM’s discretion. Make an attack roll; if the attack hits, the target must make a Strength saving throw (DC 12). On a failure, the target’s speed is reduced to zero until the axe is removed. The target can make another Strength saving throw as an action on its turn.

item.name: Javelin
entries: Javelin: As an attack, you may throw your javelin at a creature at the very limit of your range. Make an attack roll against a creature exactly 120 feet away. If the attack hits, the creature takes normal damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute.

item.name: Light Hammer
entries: As an action, you may make a single ranged weapon attack with a light hammer. If the attack hits, the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10) or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Mace
entries: Ribshatter: Make a single attack roll with your mace or morningstar against a humanoid target. This attack does normal weapon damage and the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 12). On a failure, it is stunned until the beginning of its next turn. If the damage you dealt was greater than the creature’s maximum hit dice, it is stunned until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Quarterstaff
entries: Vault: You can use your quarterstaff to help you leap long distances. You can use an action to double the length of your long jump, allowing you to leap a number of feet up to twice your Strength score (this jump is part of your movement). If you land adjacent to a creature at the end of this jump, you can make a single attack with your quarterstaff as part of this action.

item.name: Sickle
entries: Bloody Cut: When you deal damage to a living creature with a Sickle, you may twist the blade as a bonus action. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 12) or take 2d4 slashing damage.

item.name: Spear
entries: Phalanx: If you are adjacent to at least two other spear-wielders, your spear attacks have advantage.

item.name: Battleaxe
entries: Executioners Axe: If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target, you can make a single attack with your Battleaxe as an action. If you hit, you deal damage as normal, and the target must make a Strength saving throw (DC 12) or fall prone.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

Charge: If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature before hitting it with a lance attack, the target takes an extra 1d12 piercing damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target falls prone.

item.name: Longsword
entries: When a creature attacks you with a weapon, you may use your reaction to attempt to lock blades and parry their attack. Make an attack roll with your longsword. If the result of this roll equals or exceeds their attack roll, their attack misses.

item.name: Maul
entries: As an action, you can make a single attack roll with your maul against a Medium or smaller target. If the attack hits, it does normal weapon damage, and the target must make a Strength saving throw (DC 14) . On a failure, the target is pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

item.name: Morningstar
entries: Ribshatter: Make a single attack roll with your mace or morningstar against a humanoid target. This attack does normal weapon damage and the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 12). On a failure, it is stunned until the beginning of its next turn. If the damage you dealt was greater than the creature’s maximum hit dice, it is stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

item.name: Pike
entries: Phalanx: If you are adjacent to at least two other spear-wielders, your spear attacks have advantage.

item.name: Scimitar
entries: Pommel Blow: As an attack, you may draw a sheathed one-handed sword and make an attack roll to strike the enemy with its pommel, leaving the target gasping for breath. This attack deals no damage, but the next attack roll made against the target has advantage. You must have at least one hand free to take this action.

item.name: Shortsword
entries: Pommel Blow: As an attack, you may draw a sheathed one-handed sword and make an attack roll to strike the enemy with its pommel, leaving the target gasping for breath. This attack deals no damage, but the next attack roll made against the target has advantage. You must have at least one hand free to take this action.

item.name: Trident
entries: Snare: As an action, make an attack roll against a Medium creature you are grappling. If the attack hits, you catch one of the target’s limbs between the tines and bury the trident in the ground, restraining the creature until the weapon is dislodged. The target may make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice)(DC 13) at the end of each of their turns to escape.

item.name: War Pick
entries: Pointed Blow: As an action, you may pinpoint a weak point of an opponent’s armor and make a single attack with your war pick against it. This attack pierces armor, treating the target’s AC as 10 + their Dexterity modifier + 2. On a hit, this attack does normal weapon damage.

item.name: Warhammer
entries: Sundering Strike: As an attack, make an attack roll with your warhammer against a creature wielding a weapon, including natural weapons. If the attack hits, the weapon is damaged, and all attacks made with this weapon have disadvantage. Another sundering strike destroys the weapon. This attack has no effect on magical weapons unless your warhammer is also magical.

item.name: Whip
entries: Bull Whip: As part of your attack action, make a whip attack against a beast or a creature with an Intelligence score of 2 or lower. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 12) or be frightened of you until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Potion of Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Greater Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Superior Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 8d4 + 8} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 10d4 + 20} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Arcanaloth Venom
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated arcanoloth. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 {@dice 3d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Armor Oil
entries: This thick, gleaming liquid contains enough to fully coat one set of armor. For 1 hour, the armor gives +1 AC

item.name: Comprehension Potion
entries: This sparkling, bubbling clear liqid gives the drinker intelligence for one hour. The drinker gains proficiency with INT saving throws and all INT-based skills for 1 hour.

item.name: Flexing Potion
entries: This dark, heavy and brooding liquid gives the drinker strength for one hour. The drinker gains proficiency with STR saving throws and all STR-based skills for 1 hour.

item.name: Dancing Potion
entries: This whispy, oily and airy liquid gives the drinker dexterity for one hour. The drinker gains proficiency with DEX saving throws and all DEX-based skills for 1 hour.

item.name: Librarians Potion
entries: This stringent thick and lush liquid gives the drinker widsom for one hour. The drinker gains proficiency with WIS saving throws and all WIS-based skills for 1 hour.

item.name: Speakers Potion
entries: This gleaming, and radiant liquid gives the drinker dexterity for one hour. The drinker gains proficiency with CHA saving throws and all CHA-based skills for 1 hour.

item.name: Dragon Scale Potion
entries: This potion, similar in appearance to that of ancient dragon scales. The drinker gains thick scales offering a +2 bonus to their AC for one hour after drinking.

item.name: Element Oil
entries: This small bottle of purplish oil contains enough liquid to coat one Medium size creature or one object no larger than 5 sq. ft. This creature or object is resistant to one type of damage for 1 hour. Roll 1d4. 1 - Fire, 2 - Cold, 3 - Radiant, 4 - Necrotic.

item.name: Elixer of Awareness
entries: This persistently bubbling liquid is primarily clear, but flashes bright red periodically. For 2 hours after the drinker consumes the potion, they have a +5 bonus to their passive Perception and cannot be surprised.

item.name: Elixer of Day
entries: The liquid in this potion seems to give off an internal light; the potion gives off dim light in a 5 ft. radius while still in its bottle. When it is consumed, the drinker begins to emit bright light in a 10 ft. radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft. They also become resistant to radiant damage. This effect lasts for 1 hour.

item.name: Elixir of Living Death
entries: This pure black potion, appearing for all intents like a hole in space. When consumed as an action, the potion has the effects of the spell Feign Death for 1 hour. The drinker cannot be woken before the 1 hour has passed.

item.name: Elixir of Night
entries: This potion is colored in shades of gray and black that never mix, getting darker towards the center of the bottle. The drinker gains 60 ft. darkvision and can see through magical darkness for 1 hour.

item.name: Elixer of Peace
entries: This potion is light pink, with a perpetually fogged glass bottle. The drinker falls under the effect of the spell Calm Emotions: any effect causing them to be charmed or frightened is suppressed. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

item.name: Elixer of Satisfaction
entries: This dark green potion is brewed from the leaves of magically summoned Goodberries. One sip of the potion satisfies the thirst and hunger of the drinker for 1 day. The bottle contains enough liquid for 3 sips.

item.name: Elixer of True Dreams
entries: This soft, swirling blue potion must be consumed before a long rest. The drinker will experience true dreams for the duration of their rest. Roll 1d100; there is a 20% chance that they forget the dreams upon waking.

item.name: Energy Potion
entries: The bright blue liquid in this potion is shot through with moving bolts of bright yellow. The drinker gains 15 temporary hit points that last 1 hour. Once during that hour, they may also use an Action Surge and take one additional action on their turn beyond what they would normally be able to do.

item.name: Elixir of Fey
entries: This potion appears clear at first glance, but gives off opalescent swirls of color when caught by the light. For 1 day, the drinker has advantage on saving throws against being charmed and cannot be put to sleep by magic. Any magical ability that detects different types of creatures will register the drinker as fey.

item.name: Fog Breath Potion
entries: This potion resembles a smaller version of an Eversmoking Bottle. When consumed, the drinker begins to emit fog from their mouth, immediately emanating to a radius of 30 ft. For each round that they hold their mouth open, up to 1 minute, the fog spreads another 10 ft. The area of fog is heavily obscured. If the drinker attempts to close their mouth and hold in the fog, they must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 force damage.

item.name: Glamour Potion
entries: This clear liquid appears at first to be unassuming and plain, but then catches the eye, drawing attention when seen. The drinker gains proficiency with CHA saving throws and all CHA-based skills for 1 day.

item.name: Judgement Potion
entries: This clear potion appears completely still, but occasionally releases a bubble or two. The drinker gains proficiency with WIS saving throws and all WIS-based skills for 1 day.

item.name: Mind Blast Potion
entries: This deep purple potion allows the drinker to emit psychic energy. When consumed, all creatures within a 30 ft. radius of the drinker must make a DC 13 INT saving throw or take {@dice 2d8} psychic damage. The drinker becomes resistant to psychic damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Oil Accuracy
entries: This light brown oil is sufficient to coat one weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. For 1 hour, attacks made with this weapon have a +2 bonus to hit.

item.name: Potion of Rest
entries: This red potion, which tastes sugary sweet and fizzes on the tongue, invigorates the drinker. The potion can take the place of one long rest. The drinker gains all the benefits of a long rest, including restoration of hit points and spell slots.

item.name: Potion of Steel
entries: This steely gray potion grants the drinker 20 temporary hit points and gives them resistance to non-magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

item.name: Potion of Shadows
entries: This potion is contained in a shadowed glass bottle, hiding the contents within. The drinker gains a +5 bonus to DEX (Stealth) checks they make for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Song
entries: Opening the stopper of this potion reveals the faint notes of music emitted by the liquid within. When consumed, the drinker can sing a few notes, and all creatures within 30 ft. must make a DC 13 CHA saving throw against being charmed.

item.name: Aboleth Oil
entries: A creature subjected to this oil must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 14) or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease, but the creature is unaware that they have been affected After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by Sea/ or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed B c Ivv Pxs  (CONTACT)

item.name: Radiant Oils
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 16) or be poisoned for 1 minute, also taking 18 {@dice 4d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Midnight Strike
entries: A creature subjected to this poison suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. If the poison has not been neutralized before then, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 15), taking 31 (9d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Clarity Noose
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10). On a failed save, it takes 6 (1d12) poison damage and is poisoned for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't poisoned

spell.name: Forge Fire
entries: A Medium-sized fire within range, such as a campfire, burns with unnatural heat within its embers for the duration. It gives off intense heat, dealing twice as much damage to any creature that takes damage from it and consumes materials twice as fast as normal. For the duration, it can serve as a forge to smelt nonmagical metals, and counts as a forge for the purposes of blacksmithing.

spell.name: Process Hide

components.m: a hide which is consumed by the spell

entries: You work magic into a hide, turning it into processed leather. If you concentrate for the duration, you can turn a single hide into a rawhide leather, boiled leather, or tanned leather. Alternatively, you can turn hide scraps into leather scraps.

spell.name: Change Material

components.m: a common material used in the casting the spell which is consumed by the spell, turning into the new material

entries: You convert one common material into another material of equal or lesser mass and value.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th- or 5th-level spell slot, you can convert a uncommon material the same way. When you cast this spell using a 6th- or 7th-level spell slot, you can convert a rare material the same way. When you cast this spell using an 8th- or 9th-level spell slot, you can convert a very rare material the same way.

spell.name: Conjure Tool
entries: You conjure an artisan tool of your choice. It is magical in nature, but serves as a nonmagical version of that artisan tool for the duration.

spell.name: Unseen Crafter

components.m: a bit of string and of wood

entries: This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The crafter springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can’t attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the crafter to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The crafter can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Additionally, it can perform skilled crafting checks. It always uses the taking 10 rule for crafting checks, completing one check every 4 hours. Its crafting modifier is +5. When you summon it, you can summon it with one artisan tool of your choice, which only it can use. It can use any other artisan tools otherwise available. If you cast this spell again while the crafter still exists, the previous one vanishes.

Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command. If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, its crafting modifier increases by 1.

spell.name: Dimensional Toolbox
entries: You conjure an opening to a dimensional toolbox. This is stocked with every artisan tool and up to 10 gp worth of common materials. As an action, you can reach in and take out a tool or material contained within. Any tool or material that is not used when the spell ends fades away (materials used in crafting recipes remain).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the toolbox contains +1 tools (tools that add +1 to the crafting check made). When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the toolbox contains +2 tools (tools that add +2 to the crafting check made).

spell.name: Dimensional Workshop
entries: You conjure an extradimensional dwelling in range that lasts for the duration. You choose where its one entrance is located. The entrance shimmers faintly and is 5 feet wide and 10 feet tall. You and any creature you designate when you cast the spell can enter the extradimensional dwelling as long as the portal remains open. You can open or close the portal if you are within 30 feet of it. While closed, the portal is invisible.
Beyond the portal is a magnificent foyer with numerous chambers beyond. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.

You can create any floor plan you like, but the space can’t exceed 20 cubes, each cube being 10 feet on each side. The place is furnished with every artisan tool and typical crafting accessory you could need: anvils, furnaces, looms, etc. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from the workshop. When the spell ends, any creatures inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the dwelling lasts for 24 hours.

spell.name: Gwynharwyf’s Passage
entries: A furious whirlwind of glittering sand spins around you in a 20-ft. radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you.There is a 10-ft. radius cylinder of unaffected space inside thewhirlwind. Creatures in the affected area treat it as difficultterrain and take {@damage 4d6} slashing damage when they enter the area or when they begin their turn there. The whirlwind grants you and those inside it +2 AC against ranged attacks. Creatures in the affected area become blinded while inside itand for 1 round thereafter. The whirlwind also hedges outvapor, gas, and fog.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slotof 3rd or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 2d6} for each spellslot above 2nd.
